pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish and Wildlife, Fisheries Unit

descript.abstract: Statewide hydrographic features derived from the MNDNR Hydrography Dataset. This dataset is managed by the Fisheries Unit of the Minnesota DNR. The Open Water (polygon) feature class is the base layer for many derived layers, including: MNDNR Hydrography - Lakes and Open Water MNDNR Hydrography - Mine Pit Features MNDNR Hydrography - Wetland Features See many more derived layers under Associated Datasets, below The Stream Routes (linear) feature class is the base layer for many derived layers, including: MNDNR Hydrography - Stream Confluences and Flow Direction MNDNR Hydrography - Stream Routes with Stream Types Streams with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures See many more derived layers under Associated Datasets in the Streams with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures metadata, above
descript.purpose: To provide a comprehensive, statewide hydrography dataset which serves as the base GIS layer for all MNDNR business needs, including mapping, analysis, reporting, statuatory responsibilities, etc. Examples of uses are regional hydrographic modeling/analysis, basemapping, limnological studies, and linkage to MNDNR Fisheries data.

timeperd.current: Time Period of Content date indicates the date which the user can be confident of accuracy and completeness of the dataset. Re-delineations and edits are frequent and occur as needed. See the attributes DELINEATION_DATE and DELINEATION_SRC for date and source of each polygon.

idinfo.useconst: Use of the data are constrained only by the DNR GIS Data License Agreement. See the Distribution Liability section below for a link.

citeinfo.title: This is one of the major datasets within the MNDNR Hydrography Dataset Derived datasets include: Designated Infested Waters MNDNR Hydrography - MNDNR Fisheries Experimental and Special Regulations MNDNR Hydrography - DNR Fisheries Lake Survey (survey history, species presence, CPUE) MNDNR Hydrography - Fisheries Reclamation Events MNDNR Hydrography - Fishing in the Neighborhood (FiN) Ponds MNDNR Hydrography - Lakes and Open Water MNDNR Hydrography - Lakes Surveyed by MNDNR Fisheries MNDNR Hydrography - Lakes with Fish-based IBI Scores MNDNR Hydrography - Large Lakes in Minnesota MNDNR Hydrography - Mine Pit Features MNDNR Hydrography - Muskie Lakes MNDNR Hydrography - DNR Sentinel Lakes (SLICE program) MNDNR Hydrography - Stream Trout Lakes MNDNR Hydrography - Trout Lake Designation MNDNR Hydrography - Walleye Rearing Ponds MNDNR Hydrography - Wetland Features

dataqual.logic: Polygon(s) are coincident, verified closed, and intersect where intended. Lines intersect where intended.
dataqual.complete: Data exist statewide. DNR's ~ 4300+ managed lakes are well-represented. Many smaller, non-managed features may be poorly digitized or missing from this dataset.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is based originally on the 100K USGS source quadrangles. Polygons for managed waters have been improved by on-screen digitizing using DOQs and FSA imagery.

procstep.procdesc: The lake polygons are derived from the Open Water feature class of the MNDNR Hydrography SDE Dataset. See Associated Data Sets above. Open water polygon features were originally derived from USGS 100K Digital Line Graph (DLG) data. (This is the data found on the 1:100,000 USGS topo quad maps.) Considerable editing of features has taken place since the year 2000; attributes have been enhanced to better support DNR business practices. This dataset contains a collection of "best available hydrography features" from multiple sources, representing various scales and accuracies.

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number of waterbody features in DNR Hydrography SDE - Open Water Features

A unique Fisheries Waterbody ID for joining/linking polygons to DNR Fisheries Lake Survey Oracle DB. FW_IDs are assigned based on how the waterbody is managed by DNR Fisheries (i.e., an FW_ID may correspond to an entire basin '00' or to a specific sub-basin '01','01',etc.

edom.edomvd: A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing an alternate representation of a basin (implemented in SDE Dataset only)
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing a non-MN portion of a border water

attr.attrdef: Waterbody ID per DNR Ecological and Water Resources (EWR) Division's LAKESDB database; the DOWLKNUM may end in"00" (entire basin) or "01","02", etc. (sub-basin)
The Waterbody ID referring to an entire lake basin, including any bays and sub-basins. The MAIN_DOW always ends in ''00''.
Verification code indicating that the DOWLKNUM of the open-water (OW) polgyon matches the DOWLKNUM of the Public Water (PWI) polygon that it nests within.
Field that stores the hydrologic feature type
Lake Name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Alternate Name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Lake Class per DNR Fisheries Investigational Report #417 - 1992
Photo imagery source used for digitizing polygon feature

edom.edomvd: Public Water (PWI) polygon representing the Ordinary High Water Level (OHWL)

attr.attrdef: Date of polygon creation or shape update. Format (YYYY.MM.DD.1)
Surface area of waterbody in acres
Perimeter of shoreline in miles (includes island shoreline)
Flag denoting that feature has a special status (e.g., muskie lake, IBI lake, trout lake, etc.); used for the generation of Quick Layers

edom.edomvd: Feature is of a special type and has one or more attributes in the DNR Hydro Flag Table

overview.eaover: Attributes have been enhanced to better support DNR business practices. The original USCLASS codes (describing water feature type) have been retained from the USGS DLG dataset, although they have been converted from numeric codes to text waterbody type descriptions [WB_TYPE]. Descriptions of some polygons have been updated to better reflect current conditions as indicated on most recently available aerial imagery.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html
